channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: In reading, the nation's students are still stuck in a pandemic slump
item.description: New 2025 testing data shows third- through eighth-graders scored far below 2019 levels in reading. In math, some grades have made gains, but all are l...

item.title: Gov. Janet Mills of Maine to Run for Senate, Aiming at Senator Susan Collins
item.description: A two-term Democratic governor, Ms. Mills called herself “battle tested” in an interview. But she faces a Democratic primary before she can challenge ...

item.title: A Nobel Prize for explaining when technology leads to growth
item.description: The 2025 Nobel Prize in economics was awarded to Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion and Peter Howitt.

item.title: Trump to Meet With Argentina’s Leader as U.S. Moves Ahead With Bailout
item.description: President Javier Milei will visit the White House on Tuesday after the Trump administration agreed to provide Argentina a $20 billion lifeline.

item.title: Ukraine’s Formula for Peace: Fewer Talks, More Weapons
item.description: As Russia rebuffs President Trump’s diplomatic push, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine plans to head again to the White House, this time seeking...

item.title: California Forecast: Early-Season Storm Brings a Deluge of Rain
item.description: The rare October storm could cause mudslides and debris flow, forecasters said. Some residents in Los Angeles County have been told to evacuate.

item.title: Slowing Electric Vehicle Sales Will Cost G.M. $1.6 Billion
item.description: General Motors said it would lower its earnings by that amount to mainly reflect the drop in the value of equipment, factories and other assets.

item.title: Opinion: Why I'm handing in my Pentagon press pass
item.description: Tom Bowman has held his Pentagon press pass for 28 years. He says the Pentagon's new media policy makes it impossible to be a journalist, which means ...

item.title: Maine Gov. Janet Mills enters crowded Democratic race to unseat Susan Collins
item.description: Mills was reportedly recruited by Democratic Senate leaders after her high-profile confrontation with President Donald Trump in February, in which she...

item.title: Data centers are booming. But there are big energy and environmental risks
item.description: How tech companies and government officials handle local impacts will shape the industry's future in the U.S.

item.title: Madagascar’s President Goes Into Hiding
item.description: The move followed weeks of intense and deadly protests against the government of President Andry Rajoelina, who said he would defy growing calls to re...

item.title: As U.S. Warships Patrol Caribbean, Drug Smugglers Shift Tactics
item.description: With the United States surging its military presence in the region and bombing boats, countries in the Caribbean are seeing more flights carrying ille...

item.title: Ukraine’s Formula for Peace: Fewer Talks, More Weapons
item.description: As Russia rebuffs President Trump’s diplomatic push, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine plans to head again to the White House, this time seeking...

item.title: For Israel, Hamas and Trump’s Peace Plan, Now Comes the Hard Part
item.description: Hamas released hostages and agreed to abide by a cease-fire, but persuading it to lay down its arms is another matter.

item.title: Explosion at Italian Farmhouse Kills Three Military Police Officers
item.description: The police were carrying out an eviction order when a blast caused the building to collapse, officials said. More than a dozen officers were injured.
